frame.name: System_complexity
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>System</fen> is perceived as complex depending on the intricacy of the interconnectivty of its parts or components. These individual parts or components do not function as frame elements in this frame, even though they are implied by its definition. A <fen>Dimension</fen> may also be defined which situates the System within a certain domain. <ex></ex> <ex>San Diego freeways are a <t>complex</t> <fex name="System">array of poorly maintained roads</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="System">Childrens' toys</fex> <ment>are</ment> <t>simple</t> to assemble.</ex> <ex><fex name="System">The hierarchy</fex> <ment>is</ment> <t>complex</t><fex name="Dimension">in structure</fex>.</ex> <ex>The newly-discovered humanoid spoke a <fex name="Dimension">syntactically</fex> <t>complex</t> <fex name="System">language</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: System
FE.definition: <def-root>The complete entity or system whose complexity is under consideration. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Dimension</fen> provides domain specific information about the <fen>System</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Dimension
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element situates the System within a certain domain. </def-root>
